quest.name: The Mountain That Strides
journal: Axemaster Wyrnzoen requires your assistance with a troubling development.

Wyrnzoen informs you that Sighard, the boy whose parents were killed by Kujata, has gone missing. In light of your previous experiences, the axemaster has nominated you to find the wayward child. Seek out Solkwyb at the Bismarck, and discuss how you should best proceed with the search.
Solkwyb suggests that you first hear the details of Sighard's disappearance directly from the boy's grandfather. Make your way to the Red Rooster Stead in lower La Noscea and speak with Neddard.
After listening to Neddard's tale, you learn that Sighard has likely run off towards Aleport in search of Kujata. Speak with Solkwyb to plan your next move.
Solkwyb mentions an acquaintance in Aleport who might have more information on Sighard's whereabouts. Head to the coastal settlement in western La Noscea, and question the gate guard Pfarstym.

Pfarstym tells you that he saw a boy matching Sighard's description heading off to the north. Fearing for the child's safety, he urges you to make haste before a roaming pack of predators finds Sighard first. Search the area around Aleport, and attempt to pick up the boy's trail.
You have managed to discover some of Sighard's belongings, but the boy himself is nowhere to be seen. Catch up to Solkwyb, and see if her search has proven more fruitful.
Along with Solkwyb, and the sudden arrival of Wyrnzoen, you manage to rescue Sighard from a vicious pack of ravenous jackals. Return to the Red Rooster Stead and speak with the waiting Neddard.

Upon hearing your account of the rescue, Neddard apologizes for his grandson's foolhardy actions. There appears to be little more you can do for Sighard now except allow him time to recover from his injuries. Return to the Marauders' Guild and discuss with Wyrnzoen what you might best be doing.

Wyrnzoen expresses sympathy for Sighard's impatience, and directs you to return to your training. The axemaster once again vows to shape you into a weapon deadly enough to fell even the mighty Kujata.

※The next marauder quest will be available from Wyrnzoen upon reaching level 25.
objectives: Speak with Neddard at the Red Rooster Stead.
Speak with Neddard at the Red Rooster Stead.
Speak with Wyrnzoen at the Marauders' Guild.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Forename, there is trouble afoot. Do you recall the lad whose parents were slain by the beast Kujata?

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: The boy's grandfather, Neddard, but recently contacted us with worrisome news─young Sighard has gone missing.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: There have been sightings of Kujata in the area, and it would seem that the child felt compelled to seek the creature out.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: As you are familiar with the boy and his tragic tale, I would have you attend to this matter. My sister, Solkwyb, awaits you at the Bismarck. She has been apprised of the situation, and will aid you in plotting a suitable course of action.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I assume you are here to discuss the missing child, and not to sample a bowl of mutton stew?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: First things first, I would advise against rushing off to peer under every rock in the countryside. We need more information to direct our search.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: I suggest we head to the Red Rooster Stead, and learn what more we can from old Neddard.

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: Thank the gods yer 'ere. Seems me grandson is set on causin' naught but trouble fer ye.

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: But surely ye ken 'ow the lad is feelin'─'ow 'e's boilin' with 'ate fer that murderous beast.

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: An' the last time, when ye came along like an avengin' angel an' showed 'im the strength o' yer steel, well, ye lit a fire in 'is belly.

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: 'E must've got it in 'is 'ead to take revenge on the beast 'isself. Daft little bugger...

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: Anyroad, once 'e 'eard Kujata'd been spotted near Aleport, why, 'e shot through that door like an arrow from a bow, an' I ain't seen 'im since.

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: I beg of ye: find me little Sighard afore 'e gets 'isself stomped to death. That big bastard aurochs 'as spilled more'n enough o' me kin's blood...

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: I'll leave the talking to you, Forename.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Our course is clear. We must set out for Aleport at once.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: An old...acquaintance of mine, Pfarstym, often stands guard at the port gates. He might know something of the lad's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: PFARSTYM
dialogue.text: Have I seen a boy wandering about by himself? As a matter of fact, me and my fellow gate guard here just watched a young lad traipsing off to the north. We were arguing whether or not to abandon our post and bring the child back ourselves.

dialogue.name: PFARSTYM
dialogue.text: Large packs of jackals have been prowling the wilds of late, so if you mean to head after him, pray do so quickly. Hells, I might even pass along word to the Marauders' Guild─you'll be better off with an extra blade or two at your back.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Have you found any sign of Sighard?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: He must have been in a desperate hurry indeed to cast away his belongings in such a careless manner. I, myself, came across this wood axe─a tool the lad took from the Stead, perhaps?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Gods below! Forename, over there!

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“The Mountain that Strides”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: <groan> ...

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: Forename...

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Step aside!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Raaarrrggghhh!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Wyrnzoen!?

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: He breathes yet!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: We withdraw to the Red Rooster Stead. Follow my lead, Forename!

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: Ye brought 'im 'ome! I don't got the words to thank ye!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: I must concentrate. Pray do not disturb me.

dialogue.name: SIGHARD
dialogue.text: <groan> ...

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: The lad's past the worst of it. He struck his head in the fall, though, and it may be some time before he opens his eyes.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Brother. If you hadn't scattered those jackals when you did...

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I have done naught to earn your thanks. When I learned of the situation from Aleport, I realized the dangers were greater than I had anticipated. No single marauder could have hoped to fend off such numbers in time.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Pray accept my apologies, Neddard. You turned to us for help, and yet your grandson now lies before you, broken and battered...

dialogue.name: NEDDARD
dialogue.text: Ye risked yer lives to save little Sighard─'ow's a man to find fault with that? It's me who ought to be beggin' forgiveness for the wounds ye took protectin' me foolish boy.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: You needn't concern yourself with our well-being. Our training prepares us for such eventualities.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: There is naught more we can accomplish here, Forename. It is time we returned to the guild and focused on other tasks.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I am glad the lad will live, but I fear this will not be the last time Sighard abandons caution in his thirst for vengeance against Kujata.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: The wound in his heart festers and seethes, feeding his impatience at our seeming inaction.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: But we must not think ill of the boy. Instead, let his helpless rage be as a spur to our efforts.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I say again, Forename: Kujata will fall by your hand. And I will shape you into the deadly weapon you need to be.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the jackals!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Quickly now! Those curs are out for blood!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Watch your flanks!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: More have found the scent!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Ware this one's tainted jaws!
